attributes.action: monitor and remove any sexualised, abusive and bullying content from platforms online
attributes.additional_details: sites such as ask.fm are only one of the few anonymous sites where users can post hurtful and cruel messages about one another. Recently there has been an increase in cyber bullying and only in August did a young teenage girl kill herself due to the increase in hurtful messages she received from the site. If the government made it a rule to make sure sites checked what was written before it was posted and if it did fall under the category of sexual, abusive or bullying words ,then remove it. A lot less hate mail can be spread as a result and therefore lead to a decrease in cyber bullying.

rejection.details: There is already an e-petition concerning Ask.FM, and a reply should be posted shortly.   The Government is aware of this, and is in contact with regulators about it.
